intro: Vellozia teres, commonly known as the narrow-leaf vellozia, is a unique member of the Restionaceae family native to South Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Vellozia teres is known for its distinctive floral structure, which consists of tightly packed, spike-like clusters of small white flowers. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
